result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric James Rowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
